titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Charles Stacy French Papers
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Papers include correspondence, articles, speeches, manuscripts, lab notes, charts, and computer printouts pertaining largely to his research interests in the photosynthesis of purple bacteria, spectroscopy of plant pigments, and the construction of spectroscopic equipment. Papers also include approximately 400 glass and film slides of charts, graphs, plants, equipment, laboratories, and other scientists.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Charles Stacy French Papers (SC0474). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: French, plant physiologist, was director of the Dept. of Plant Biology of the Carnegie Institution, located on the Stanford University campus, from 1947 until his retirement in 1973. Prior to his arrival at Carnegie, he taught at the Harvard Medical School, the University of Chicago, and the University of Minnesota.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Papers include correspondence, articles, speeches, manuscripts, lab notes, charts, and computer printouts pertaining largely to his research interests in the photosynthesis of purple bacteria, spectroscopy of plant pigments, and the construction of spectroscopic equipment. Papers also include approximately 400 glass and film slides of charts, graphs, plants, equipment, laboratories, and other scientists.

did.unittitle: Correspondence, 1935-1971; French’s lab books, 1947-1974; bibliography and biography file; biography of Jens Christian Clausen by C.S. French
Lab notes, articles, papers; many concern the curve analyzer and other apparatus
Lab notes; talks, 1937-1947; Chicago work; subjects include curve analyzer, differential spectrophotometer, and photosynthesis
Lab notes and papers re purple bacteria and photosynthesis
Computer Printouts; Data & MSS figures for publication
Absorption Spectra: Computer Printouts & Lab Notes
Absorption Spectra: Computer Printouts & Lab Notes
Absorption Spectra, cont.; French's lab books, 1969-1980; computer printouts
Lab books; Lab notes, papers, correspondence, page proofs, typescript articles, 1955-1962
Lab notes, typescript articles, reprints on fluorescence and other topics; speeches from the 1970s
Lab notes, manuscripts, data for papers, mostly from 1940s
Rolled charts and folders; computer tape
Computer Printouts: BAND 1, BKG2, Basic Course, PROPS (1970), STAT, Digitizer, SYNSP, Splot & Resolv, Resolv & Splot Nielsen Manuscript
35mm film slides of charts, tables, graphs
35mm film slides of plants, bacteria, labs and instruments, and people
Grating tests and monochromotor const. fluoresc. spectrophotometer. C. S. French, 1974 -March 14, 1949
Action spectra for Chyll-formation; start of curve analyser; recording fluorescence spectrophotometer 1949-1952; monochromator calibrations. C. S. French
Fluorescence spectrophotometry. C. S. French, Jan. 1, 1953 -Dec. 1, 1964
Automatic plotting of action spectra for photosynthesis. Porphyridium cruentum etc. Transients, various algae. C. S. French, Guy McLeod, 1959-1960
Fluorescence apparatus; claes chlorella fl. etc.; monochromator C. S. French, M. Lawrence, 1965-1973
Spectrophotometer. C. S. French, M. Lawrence, August 1966 -September 1975
Action spectra. Glenn Ford and Hagar, Sept. 6, 1972 -March 1973
Action and [illegible], 1987; includes copy of a letter to French from Jack Myers, 1988
